# Reading the data sets

First dataset is a control meaning that the total RNA was used at the same concentrations as Df2dataset but no enzyme were used (reverse transcriptase).
Df1dataset contains control only RNA reactions for Df2dataset.
As seen from the file name the experiment date is 17.07.2020 and the strain is WT.

```{r}

Df1dataset <- read_delim("Data/2020 07 17 onlyRNAcontwtBW rtQpcr.txt", 
    "\t", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE , skip = 10, n_max = 39) 
Df1dataset <- janitor::remove_empty(Df1dataset) 
Df1dataset <- rename(Df1dataset,  TmValue = `Tm Value`)
Df1dataset <- Df1dataset %>% select (-c( NAW, EAF))
Df1dataset <- mutate(Df1dataset, Bacteria = "WT" , TDate = "2020-07-17")
Df1dataset <- mutate(Df1dataset, SamP = `Sample Name` )
Df1dataset <- rename(Df1dataset, Strain = `Sample Name` )
Df1dataset$Ct <- as.numeric(Df1dataset$Ct, digits = 4, is.numeric = TRUE)
```

cDNA synthesis: WT1.2 and WT2.2 were used. Both ISMmix primers and Random Primers were used for the cDNA synthesis. But for the SYBR dye based qPCR reactions WT1.2 with Random primers were used.

```{r}
Df2dataset <- read_delim("Data/2020 07 17 wtBW rtQpcr.txt", 
    "\t", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE , skip = 10, n_max = 78) 
Df2dataset <- janitor::remove_empty(Df2dataset) 
Df2dataset <- rename(Df2dataset,  TmValue = `Tm Value`)
Df2dataset <- Df2dataset %>% select (-c( NAW, EAF, HNS, CAF))
Df2dataset <- mutate(Df2dataset, Bacteria = "WT" , TDate = "2020-07-17")
Df2dataset <- mutate(Df2dataset, SamP = `Sample Name` )
Df2dataset <- rename(Df2dataset, Strain = `Sample Name` )
Df2dataset$Ct <- as.numeric(Df2dataset$Ct, digits = 4, is.numeric = TRUE)
Df2dataset <- filter(Df2dataset, !(SamP %in% c("H16")))
```

missing data-no curve  I9, G9, H9
varying data between replica I12, G12, H12, I16, G16, H16

This happened, many unreliable rows, because I forgot to spin the samples down in the plate!

```{r}
Df3dataset <- read_delim("Data/2020 07 18 good dataISM mix primers WT.txt", 
    "\t", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE , skip = 10, n_max = 68) 
Df3dataset <- janitor::remove_empty(Df3dataset) 
Df3dataset <- rename(Df3dataset,  TmValue = `Tm Value`)
Df3dataset <- Df3dataset %>% select (-c(HNS))
Df3dataset <- mutate(Df3dataset, Bacteria = "WT", TDate = "2020-07-18")
Df3dataset <- mutate(Df3dataset, SamP = `Sample Name` )
Df3dataset <- rename(Df3dataset, Strain = `Sample Name` )
Df3dataset$Ct <- as.numeric(Df3dataset$Ct, digits = 4, is.numeric = TRUE)
Df3dataset <- filter(Df3dataset, !(SamP %in% c("H16", "G4", "H10", "I10", "I11", "G14", "I13", "M8", "M15", "I9", "G9", "H9", "I12", "G12", "H12", "I16", "G16", "H16"  )))

```
qPCR setup: 10uL of reactions 13 primer couple using WT1.1, WT1.2 (the cells were collected from the same flask and purified separately) WT2.1, WT2.2 were treathed the same way as the previous samples.
The experiment have no "onlyRNA" control. So that B/C/D and J/K/L and F/G/H and N/O/P represent the well positions where the qPCR occur.
Following wells should be thrown out:
L15, H16, D4, B5, B11

```{r}
Df10dataset <- read_delim("03 11 2021 results new Roche.txt", 
    "\t", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE)

exp21tidy <- Df10dataset %>% mutate(seqism = seq(1, 156, by=1)) %>% filter(seqism== c(1:39)) %>% mutate(BioRep = "df1", Bacteria = "WT") %>% select (-c(seqism))

exp22tidy <- Df10dataset %>% mutate(seqism = seq(1, 156, by=1)) %>% filter(seqism== c(40:78)) %>% mutate(BioRep = "df2", Bacteria = "WT") %>% select (-c(seqism))

exp24tidy <- Df10dataset %>% mutate(seqism = seq(1, 156, by=1)) %>% filter(seqism >= 118) %>% mutate(BioRep = "df2", Bacteria = "ybeX") %>% select (-c(seqism))

Df11dataset <- rbind(exp21tidy, exp22tidy, exp23tidy, exp24tidy)

```

## Marking the second ybeX RT -qPCR dataset

Df9dataset belongs to ybeX::KAN strain, meaning that the cDNA synthesis was perfomed using total RNA purified from ybeX strain, importantly hexamers were used while the synthesis. Only Df1dataset and Df9dataset origins from hexamer used cDNA reactions.

m1 <- brm(bf(Ct~Gene:Bacteria, sigma~Gene:Bacteria), 
          family = student(), 
          prior=prior(normal(0,10), class="b"), 
          chains = 3, cores = 3, 
          data=tidydatarep, 
          file = "m1.fit")
          



conditional_effects(m1, effects = "Gene:Bacteria" )


m2 <- brm(Ct~Gene:Bacteria, 
          family = student(), 
          data=tidydatarep, 
          prior=prior(normal(0,10), class="b"), 
          chains = 3, cores = 3,
          file = "m2")
add_criterion(m2, "loo")




conditional_effects(m2, effects = "Gene:Bacteria" )



m2p <- as_draws_array(m2)
posterior::summarize_draws(m2p)
m2p1 <- m2p[,-c(1, 27:30)]
m2p2 <- m2p1 + m2p[,1]

names(m2p2)
